title: Characteristics of the graph of the parent function
text:
The function $$f(x)=\log_{b}\left(xight)$$, $$b>0$$ and $$b$$ not equal to $$1$$, has the following properties: - one-to-one function
- vertical asymptote: $$x=0$$
- domain: $$(0,\infty)$$
- range: $$(-\infty,\infty)$$
- x-intercept: $$(1,0)$$ and key point (b,1)
- y-intercept: none
- increasing if $$b>1$$
- decreasing if $$0<b<1$$

title: Transformations of log functions
text: To achieve the function above, the parent function is translated $$6$$ units to the left, horizontally compressed by a factor of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, and translated $$5$$ units down. How does this affect the domain and vertical asymptote?
